entry.title: Re: NOW RELEASED: Upload and work with external files in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation
entry.content:
@lschenck : in general the storage of the external files on BTP SMD gives you a seamless integration of the file to the internal SAP Cloud ALM document. The internal document stores the meta data and controls the versioning of the external file (in two weeks we will display also the external file version in our internal document). The external files shall be just edited through the internal document, including performing status changes, approval procedures and workflows as well as future authorization concepts for internal and thus also external documents. This prevents from unintended edits direclty to the files or their deletion (it is always treated as one object). Compared to this, the representation of the external file as a reference link is very loose without any control from SAP Cloud ALM side.  

Regarding the storage space: 
The storage of 8GB is dedicated to the internal document content, while the external files are allocating the space of BTP DMS. Here the BTP Document management service is used, which has its own price based on your package.

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration with Concur Solutions: Default Configuration
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

on the context of CONCUR interface with SAP ERP  I’m reaching out to seek your guidance regarding a specific scenario involving SAP and CONCUR, particularly in the context of employee data privacy regulations in the United States and Canada.

As you may know, both countries enforce strict regulations concerning the protection of employee personal data—especially sensitive fields such as gender, home address, and bank account information. In alignment with our internal compliance policies, we avoid storing this data in SAP, which currently prevents us from processing employee travel expense payments directly through SAP for US and Canadian employees.

While our global setup leverages CONCUR integrated with SAP to manage travel expense reimbursements, the exception for these two countries creates a divergence in our process. Our goal is to harmonize the payment workflow across all regions, but the data protection constraints present a challenge.

In this context, I would appreciate insights on the following:

              What are the best practices adopted by other organizations facing similar constraints?

              Does CONCUR offer any recommended approaches or configurations to address this issue?

              Are there SAP features or mechanisms—such as data masking, encryption, or restricted access—that could allow us to securely store and process banking information while remaining compliant?

Any suggestions, documentation, or references you could share would be highly valuable.

entry.title: JCo Parameters
entry.content:
Hello together,

we have connected our SAP ECC System with our WACOS Warehouse Management System via Direkt RFC with SAP JCO. 

After switching our quality System to SAP ECS Cloud we had the Problem that the rfc queue in sm58 was only precessing one call every few minutes. 

 

We changed the following parameter jco.server.connection_count from 1 to 40. After that the Performance of processing RFC Calls was much better than before. 

But we are not sure if it's enogh to change the parameter up to 40 or if we must rise it higher.

In normal Business we are packing our parcels at nearly 20-25 packing stations. Each parcel needs 2 RFC Calls. In the logging we saw that each call creates up to 5 Connections at one time. So is it ok when we rise the parameter up to 100 oder higher? Or will we get some Problems then?

These parameters were changed additionally:

jco.destination.peak_limit=50

jco.destination.pool_capacity=40

jco.destination.expiration_time=900000

jco.destination.expiration_period=600000

jco.destination.max_get_time=60000 

Does anybody have experience with that?

Thanks in advance!

Gunther

entry.title: Welcome "Requirement Approver" in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALM now includes a dedicated “Requirement Approver” role. A long-requested feature that brings clarity, control, and structure to the requirement approval process in your projects.

Background – How It Was Before

Until now, any project member could approve requirements in SAP Cloud ALM. This meant there was no clear responsibility or structure around who should approve a requirement, leading to confusion, lack of accountability, and inconsistency in project delivery.

Many of you shared the same feedback:

“We need a way to define who is actually allowed to approve requirements.”

And we heard you.

 

 

 What's Changed?

With the new update, you can now assign a specific “Requirement Approver” role to team members within your project. Once this is done:

  • Only users assigned to this role can approve requirements.
  • Project Administrators will always retain the right to approve.
  • If no approvers are assigned, things work like before, that is any user with the right permission can approve. So things work as usual if you want the current behaviour to continue.
  • Users in the “Requirement Approver” role will receive a notification when a requirement is set to Ready for Approval making sure nothing slips through the cracks.

 

How It Works – At a Glance

  1. Assign the Role: In your project team settings, assign one or more users to the new “Requirement Approver” role.
  2. Control Approval: From that point on, only these users (and Project Admins) will be able to approve requirements.
  3. Stay Informed: When a requirement is marked as Ready for Approval, approvers receive a notification with details and a link to review and approve directly.

Note: This applies to projects without workflow subscriptions. If your project uses workflows, those rules still apply.

 

Why This Matters

This change adds structure and clarity to the requirement lifecycle in your SAP Cloud ALM projects:

  • You now have better governance over who can approve.
  • It improves project accountability and avoids unintentional approvals.
  • It supports a cleaner, more organized approval process—especially in large teams or complex implementations.

 

What You Need to Do

  • Head over to your project team settings.
  • Assign the “Requirement Approver” role to users who should have the authority.
  • You're all set! Your approval process is now more streamlined and secure.

 

This small but powerful update brings real value to teams using SAP Cloud ALM. It helps everyone stay aligned, ensures only the right people approve critical requirements, and brings more structure across all task types.

We hope you find this helpful and as always, keep the feedback coming!

entry.title: Local OData API Access in Edge Integration Cell Runtimes
entry.content:
With the usage of Edge Integration Cell runtime, a mixture of Cloud and On-Prem solutions is utilized in some aspects. One of these aspects is calling the OData APIs. When the clients try to make such API calls in the Edge Integration Cell runtimes, their queries are bypassing the cloud to reach the corresponding edge cluster.  As long as the connectivity to the cloud is available, these scenarios will work properly. However, in case the cloud connection is broken, the clients will not be able to use such APIs and consequently will not be able to monitor their edge runtime properly.

To tackle the above problem, a new feature is added to the cloud integration for the edge-enabled runtimes by which the clients are able to call a subset of monitoring APIs without the intervention of cloud, so called "Local API Access". 

In this Blog I will try to address this topic and how can this feature be used by the clients properly. We will see how can we configure the edge clusters to enable the Local Access(API Plan). I will also provide the information on how the APIs can be called and finally will provide a list of the APIs which are currently exposed locally. 

 

Configure Cluster to Support API Plan

The first step for using Local API Access, is activating the API Plan support to the cluster. This can be done using the ELMO UI. By selecting the desired cluster and modify the configuration, you will see the new settings available also for the API Plan: API Virtual Host and API Virtual Host Key Alias. These settings are also available upon on-boarding of a new edge node. This is also depicted in the following picture. 

  • API Virtual Host can be any preferred valid domain name of your choice. In case this is supposed to be exposed to internet, then this also needs to be registered in the DNS as well. 
  • API Virtual Host Key Alias is similar to what you have in the default virtual host. This is the alias of keystore entry which contains a valid key and is stored on the corresponding edge runtime. 

 

Configuring API Plan Support in ELMO UI

 

Once these settings are applied, the corresponding new resources will be created in the K8s cluster including a new Gateway which is created for directly accessing the APIs. The Edge runtime will now be able to handle local API calls. 

 

Required Authentication Setups for calling APIs

At the time of writing this Blog and in the initial increment of this feature only the certificate-based authentication is supported for local API Accesses. As the clients are making calls against the new API Virtual Host directly and this is handled by HTTPS connectivity, an MTLS connectivity is required to be established to the cluster. The clients are required to provide the public and private keys for a TLS Connection. The required service key(needed for the public and private keys) can be achieved using the BTP Account Cockpit in cloud integration. You need to create(or use the existing one) a new API Service instance for accessing APIs as followed

  • Service: Process Integration Runtime 
  • Plan: Process Integration API access

Service Instance Creation for API Plan

 

 

You then need to create a new service key (or use the existing one) in the above Service Instance using the Certificate client type. Once this is created successfully use the created credentials for the TLS connection. You can use the certificate chain as well as the key entry which are provided there in the newly created credential.

Creating new Certificate Key for API Plan Service Instance

Accessing Certificate and Private Key for calling Local APIs

 You need to consider that accessing certain APIs requires also special permissions(Roles) and for having proper access to the APIs you need to assign all the required Roles to your service instance at the time of creation too. 

You can use the certificates and key in the above in order to establish a TLS connection to your cluster and calling the desired API with your favorite REST Client. For simplicity, you can also keep the above data in two different files and simply refer to them in your REST Clients e.g. Curl.

 

Calling the APIs 

So far, we have seen how to activate the API plan on the edge runtimes and also how to properly setup the required athentication parameters to make the API Calls. We are now good to see how the actual API call works. For this, you need add a /local prefix to your defined Virtual Host followed by /ap1/v1/<Desired Endpoint>. Adding the /local prefix here is important, as this will be used to distinguish the local API calls from the calls via cloud. If you do not use the /local prefix then a 401 Unauthorized error would be thrown, even if you use a valid credential. 

Here is an example of the API Call: https://<YOUR_DEFINED_VIRTUAL_HOST>/local/api/v1/<DESIRED_ENDPOINT_TO_BE_CALLED>

  • <YOUR_DEFINED_VIRTUAL_HOST>: This is the Virtual Host that you have defined for your your edge Runtime in ELMO UI
  • /local: This prefix is required to be added to the endpoint call in order to distinguish the local calls from the calls via cloud
  • /api/v1: Conventially used for calling APIs, similar to the calls over the cloud
  • /<DESIRED_ENDPOINT_TO_BE_CALLED>: The desired endpoint which is supposed to be called. This is similar to the calls over cloud.
    • e.g. MessageProcessingLogs

As mentioned earlier, for the initial increment of this feature only a subset of the APIs are exposed for local access, here is the list these APIs:

  • /MessageProcessingLogs
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /MessageProcessingLogErrorInformations
      • /MessageProcessingLogAttachments
      • /MessageProcessingLogCustomHeaderProperties
  • /MessageStoreEntries
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /MessageStoreEntryProperties
      • /MessageStoreEntryAttachments
      • /MessageStoreEntryAttachmentProperties
  • /DataStores
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /DataStoreEntries
  • /JmsBrokers
  • /Variables

The complete definition and usage of the APIs is defined in the official SAP API documentation page . The usage of the APIs should be adapted according to the above explanations for the local accesses. Please consider that the APIs are only exposed for the Monitoring purposes. This means, that only Get REST API calls are allowed to be done locally and none of the other methods would be available.

 

Future Improvements

Given the above information about the usage of the Local API Access by the initial increment, there are some enhancements on the road map for the future as followed.

  • Supporting the OAuth2 mechanism for the Authorization
    • This will provide more flexibility for the clients to use the OAuth2 flow similar to the cloud to call the APIs locally
  • Relaxing the /local prefix addition to the API path
    • With this change the clients will not require any more to add the /local prefix to the API URLs anymore. After adding this enhancement, both URLs would be supported either with or without /local prefix.

entry.title: Re: Packing Process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (...
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can absolutely support this using Handling Units (HUs) and Packaging Specifications. SAP uses Handling Units (HUs) to manage packaging structures. Your scenario would be modeled as

  • Base product → packed into sacks (first-level HU)
  • Sacks → packed onto pallets (second-level HU)

This is called multi-level HU packaging, and it is supported in both delivery processing and warehouse management.

In order to achieve your requirement, do the following: -

Use the app: Manage Product Master Data from which, create materials for Sack and Pallet. For both these, you can consider material type VERP. Assign packaging material group, dimensions, and weight

Use the app: Manage Packaging Specifications. Here, define how many base units go into a sack. Define how many sacks go onto a pallet and set validity dates, condition records, and HU templates

Next, use the app: Manage Your Solution → SSCUI. Activate HU management for relevant storage locations.

Use Delivery-Based Packing with the app: Change Outbound Delivery. Use automatic packing based on packaging specs, or manually pack using Pack function in delivery

entry.title: Supporting Digital Transformation with SAP Digital Payments
entry.content:
Supporting Digital Transformation in Consumer Industries with SAP Digital Payments

In the digital age, consumer industry customers have been increasingly tasked with overhauling their digital payments strategy, business processes, and supporting software. Offering flexible payment options for their customers is no longer a “nice to have” but is critical in achieving a best-in-class customer experience. SAP supports customers in their journey to become market leaders by offering a fully integrated digital payments solution catered to the needs of the consumer industry.

Introducing SAP Digital Payments

SAP Digital Payments is a cloud-based integration solution running on SAP’s Business Technology Platform (BTP) that enables the processing of electronic payments in core business applications. Through the use of API’s it has out-of-the-box integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and supports card registration, payment authorization, refunds, settlement, and payment advice. Through the adoption of clean-core concepts, SAP Digital Payments enables customers to quickly adapt to changes in the market as well as their own corporate strategies and initiatives.

Security and Compliance

Failing to secure sensitive data such as credit card information can be catastrophic to a business. In addition to providing end-to-end encrypted processing of payment card transactions across systems, SAP Digital Payments eliminates the need for storage and processing of sensitive credit card details, which provides a higher degree of security and reduces PCI auditing efforts. The solution is compliant according to the latest Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS 4.0) which enables end-user trust that their information is protected from unauthorized access and data breaches.

Clean Core

One of the key value drivers of the solution is that it supports the clean core concept by decoupling integration with PSPs. De-coupling has several benefits. For starters, it allows a customer to support more than one PSP at a time or easily switch from one PSP to another with nothing more than a configuration update. Secondly, it eliminates the need to add custom code (whether customer developed, or partner supplied) in the core Cloud ERP system. This makes future upgrade easier, faster, and less costly. Finally, it enables customers to adopt payment card industry best practices with minimal effort and out-of-the-box support.

RISE with SAP

Did you know SAP Digital Payments is a required solution for RISE customers processing credit cards in their S/4HANA system? When customers process payment card transactions on SAP operated infrastructure, PCI-DSS requirements become applicable to SAP. As such, SAP must provide a mechanism for customers to follow best practices and secure sensitive credit card information. SAP Digital Payments is critical (in fact contractually mandatory) in achieving this.

 Key Take Away

As a cloud-based solution, adoption of SAP Digital Payments is critical for customers in their cloud journey and digital transformation initiatives. It is SAP’s strategic direction for processing of payment cards and integrating with Payment Service Providers. Consumer Industry customers benefit from its innovative approach to securing sensitive payment transactions and consumer data.

entry.title: Re: RPCNETN0 page down button not working in subscreen
entry.content:
In batch input, page down and page up are like pressing enter, it's explained in the SAP note 11788 - Batch input, variable step loop or table control - SAP for Me.

The workaround is to find a button or menu which is equivalent to scrolling.

There's often a button to position at a given line (Find, etc.)

If there's none, you need to do a modification of standard to provide a function code to do this positioning and use it via Batch input.

entry.title: SuccessFactors API using OAuth authentication method via SAP Offline SAML Assertion generator
entry.content:
Introduction

When integrating with SAP SuccessFactors, secure authentication is critical. Since HTTP Basic Authentication is deprecated, SAP recommends using OAuth 2.0 authentication for API access. A commonly used approach is the OAuth 2.0 SAML Bearer Assertion flow, where a signed SAML assertion is exchanged for an OAuth access token.

For scenarios where interactive login is not possible (e.g., background jobs, middleware integrations), SAP provides an Offline SAML Assertion Generator. This tool enables the creation of signed SAML assertions offline, which can then be used to authenticate securely against SuccessFactors APIs.

1. Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure the following setup is in place:

  • API  User: A dedicated SuccessFactors API user exists

  • Certificates:

    Private key available to sign SAML assertions (used by the Offline Generator).

  • OAuth Client: Configured in SuccessFactors, with required API permissions.

Please see below the step by step guide to configure :

TASK 1 - Registering Your OAuth2 Client Application in Successfactors

  1. Create an Odata API user SF_ODATA_API in SuccessFactors with the required permissions:

 

  1. Registering Your OAuth2 Client Application in Successfactors:

 

 

 

By default, the company name will come here:

 

 

 

Now fill the required details:

  1. Application Name: You can use any name here but ideally you should prefer to give a name who will be using the Oauth for connect to the SuccessFactors so that it will be easy for any consultant to understand which Application is using Oauth for SuccessFactors.
  2. Description: Give some logical description about the set up or you can keep this blank as well.
  3. Application URL: You can pass any URL of the company requesting for the setup of Oauth . For example let’s say if my company  is XYZ trying to use this Oauth then you can put the URL as https://xyx.com , if CPI is using this Oauth then provide the CPI URL here https://XYX6Z.tmn.hci.eu1.hana.ondemand.com , if google is using this then give https://google.com.
  4. Bind to users: (Optional) You can enable this option to restrict the access of the application to specific users including business users and technical users. This is not required to check.
  5. User IDs: Ideally, we don’t bind with users so that anyone can access it. It is required if you enabled the Bind to User option (if point 4 is enabled), Enter the user IDs separated by comma who can only access the Oauth.
  6. X-509 Certificate: Click the button below to Generate X.509 certificate and it will open a window as shown below:

Click below button:

 

It will open a window as shown below:

 

 

  1. If you see closely only one field is mandatory here i.e. the common Name (CN) and here, you can put the Odata API username which you have created in the first step i.e. SF_ODATA_API.

 

 

  1. Please fill the username in the Common Name (CN) field and click on generate: After you click on Generate the below window will open. Download and copy the certificate and keep it in your local folder.

 

 

 

  1. Click on Register so that API key will be generated: Once you click Register then it will take you to the below screen:

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Click on View to see the API key:

 

 

  1. So, the registration is successful in Successfactors and till this step we have the below details with us: Keep all the information in your local drive so that you can find it quickly.

 

  1. Odata API user: SF_ODATA_API
  2. X-509 Certificate: Please note you can use the certificate from the downloaded file in the step no 8 when you open the downloaded file you can see two things inside the file one is the private key encrypted and other one is Begin of certificate and end of certificate. Please note we must choose the Private key encrypted file for the SAML generation later using command prompt in this document.

 

 

 

  1. API Key:

 

                  You can also edit, disable, and delete an OAuth2 client registration.

TASK 2 - Generating a SAML Assertion

Generate a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) assertion for requesting an OAuth    token. I am going to explain how you can generate the SAML Assertion locally.

  1. Downloading the Maven file

You can download the maven file using the below link, this will help us to generate the SAML assertion which we will be using for the Oauth call using the postman: https://maven.apache.org/download.cgi

 

Download the below Zip file:

Binary zip archive     apache-maven-3.9.6-bin.zip

 

 

Click the link above and download the zip file in your local PC: The file will look like as shown below.

 

 

Unzip the file and keep in the below folder in C drive.

 

 

 

  1. Install the JDK latest version, you can easily get the free version if you search in google.

Choose the one which is required for your operating system. When you download and install, it will create the file in C drive as shown below:

  

 

 

  1. Use the command prompt and pass CD\ to go to the root directory i.e. C drive.  

     

Press Enter and you will use the below steps to confirm that maven and JDK installed :

  1. CD\: To go to main directory
  2. echo %JAVA_HOME%: To check the Java Home
  3. java -version to check whether jdk installed properly with which version.      

              

 

  1. cd C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin: It will reach the directory C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin
  2. Use mvn -v to check the Maven Apache version as seen below.

 

  1. Now we are confirming that Maven and JDK latest version are installed in the system.
  2. Change the system environment variables by searching the settings in the start button of your PC.

 

  1. Click on the environment Variables and below window will open:

 

Click on New and add the below details both in User variables as well as the System Variables, give the variable name as PATH and variable value as the location of the maven file, in my case it is stored in C drive. Similarly, give variable name as JAVA_HOME and give the variable value as the location of the JDK file as given below Please follow the below and add in both new user variable as well as in the system variable:

Variable Name: PATH

Variable value: C:\apache-maven-3.9.6\bin

Variable Name: JAVA_HOME

Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-21

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Click Ok and you can see both the path and press ok to proceed. You can see now both the path has been updated.

 

 

  1.    Go to the attachment of the KBA , 3031657 - How to generate SAML assertion using SAP-provided offline tool - SuccessFactors - SAP for Me and download it and keep in C-drive.

 

Unzip the file and keep it in the c: drive as shown below:

 

Open the folder and open SAMLAssertion.properties as shown below:

 

When you will open SAMLAssertion.properties file you will find some dummy entries inside it, and we need to clean it and use the details which we have in TASK-1.

 

 

 

After cleaning the dummy value, the screen should visible as shown below:

 

Now we need to fill the details:

  1. token URL: https://<SF API URL>/oauth/token for example it should be something like https://api12preview.sapsf.eu/oauth/token.
  2. ClientID: API Key which you received while registering the client in Successfactors in our case the ClientID is  

     

      . You can refer above in TASK-1 step no 10.
  3. userName:The username(Odata API user we have used in CN name i.e. SF_ODATA_API)
  4. privateKey : The certificate we have copied from the manage Oauth from SuccessFactors at Task-1 step no 10.
  5. expireInMinutes=100000 ( Maximum possible value is 5258880)
  6. Save everything as mentioned above in a file and then run the script as mentioned below.
  7. Command -   cd C:\SAMLAssertionGen-master

 

 

  1. Press enter to go to the directory C:\SAMLAssertionGen-master

 

  1. Execute the below command now.

mvn compile exec:java -Dexec.args="SAMLAssertion.properties”

 

Press Enter:

It will start generation the saml assertion and you can see the here how it started but the actual saml assertion which we need to call the API in successfactors using Oauth we will be finding it at the end of the saml generation.

 

 

Assertion:

 

 

Once completed, it would generate SAML assertion. Copy this and store it securely in your local drive.

 

TASK-3 Calling ODATA API from Successfactors using Postman.

 

Now we have all the details with us, for example:

  1. SuccessFactors company ID
  2. SF API Key (from Manage Oauth)
  3. SAML Assertion

We must do two steps to query the data from the success factors Oauth.

  1. First Step: In this step, we will be calling the SuccessFactors to get the Oauth token. Please see the screenshot:

 

 

company_ID: Successfactors instance company id

client_id: API Key from the SuccessFactors Manage Oauth2 (Refer Task-1)

grant_type: urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:saml2-bearer

Assertion: SAML assertion generated in Task-2 (Refer to the last steps)

 

Now we have the token, we can move to step-2 to query the data from the SuccessFactors.

  1. Second Step: In this step we will be using the token generated in the above step and query the data from the SuccessFactors. Please see below screenshot.

 

 

You have put the query to get the data and select Authorization as Bearer token. In the Token field pass the token we got in the Step 1 and query the data. The query will be successful, and you will be getting the data.

 

 

You can export the collection from the postman and can share with the third party so that they can directly use this to set up to query the data using Oauth from SuccessFactors.

entry.title: Re: Using movement type 701 and 702 to calculate material...
entry.content:
To your question, "can 701 & 702 movement types used to update consumption statistics?", the answer is NO, not by default. Movement types 701/702 are not considered for consumption movements in standard SAP. They represent adjustments to reconcile book stock with actual counted stock. Standard consumption statistics (used in LIS reports like MC.9, or for reorder point planning) are updated by goods issue movements such as:

  • 201/261 (consumption to cost center/order)
  • 601 (GI for delivery)
  • 701/702 are excluded because they are not “real” consumption but they are corrections.

To explain with an example, if you had 100 pcs in SAP but counted 95 pcs physically, posting the difference with 702 reduces stock by 5 pcs. This is not treated as consumption, but as an inventory adjustment.

entry.title: Dynamic Template Download Upload Report on Year
entry.content:
Introduction (Requirement):

We need to develop a program to upload the Monthly Production plan. In input screen user will enter the year and execute we should get an excel template downloaded with columns Matnr , Plant and followed month of year. Upload function we will fill those details and upload will be saved to custom table and we need to give runtime save in alv(editable).

Example:

PlantModel name25-Jan25-Feb25-Mar25-Apr25-May25-Jun25-Jul25-Aug25-Sep25-Oct25-Nov25-Dec
A010B21000400300500500300200500500604030
A010B32004003005005003002005005006040200
A010B45004003005005003002005005006040400
A010B53004003005005003002005005006040600

Main Portion (Explanation):

In this example we will get year as input then we generate this template, and we will upload the same but there is twist we will upload data column-wise, but we need to update it row-wise here,

A010, B2, 1000, 2025, 01(Jan) this will one record in same way we will update all 12 records with respect to first row as A010, B2, 30, 2025, 12(Dec) in custom table.

Difficult things to do in this task:

  • Generating the excel template on year (but we can do it easily). 
  • Handling uploaded data where in this requirement we need to update data row-wise in the system.
  • Selection Screen Design (Easy).

Simple Implementation: 

REPORT zztest_download_upload.

TABLES: sscrfields.
TYPE-POOLS: truxs.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_data,
         col1  TYPE string,
         col2  TYPE string,
         col3  TYPE string,
         col4  TYPE string,
         col5  TYPE string,
         col6  TYPE string,
         col7  TYPE string,
         col8  TYPE string,
         col9  TYPE string,
         col10 TYPE string,
         col11 TYPE string,
         col12 TYPE string,
         col13 TYPE string,
         col14 TYPE string,
       END OF tp_data.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_heading,
         heading(30),
       END OF tp_heading.

DATA: gt_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gf_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gv_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gd_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gs_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gt_heading  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_heading,
      gs_heading  TYPE tp_heading,
      gt_fieldcat TYPE TABLE OF slis_fieldcat_alv,
      gs_fieldcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
      lv_date     TYPE string,
      lv_month    TYPE string,
      lv_year     TYPE string,
      lv_new_date TYPE string,
      lv_index    TYPE sy-tabix,
      lv_cell     TYPE string,
      index       TYPE I.
DATA : gs_prod_plan TYPE zzmm_m_prod_plan.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_cell>    TYPE string,
               <fs_input>   TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_input_1> TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_month>   TYPE tp_data,
               <fs_value>   TYPE any,
               <fs_value_1> TYPE any.
DATA : lv_field               TYPE char5,
       gv_model               TYPE mname,
       gv_plant               TYPE mcode,
       gv_filename            TYPE string,
       gv_path                TYPE string,
       gv_fullpath            TYPE string,
       gv_result              TYPE i,
       gv_template_downloaded TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false,
       it_raw                 TYPE truxs_t_text_data,
       gv_year                TYPE char4.

*INITIALIZATION.
*  gv_year = sy-datum+0(4).

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
  PARAMETERS: rb_down RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND rb-s1,
              rb_up   RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  PARAMETERS: s_file TYPE rlgrap-filename MODIF ID sc2.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  SELECT-OPTIONS: p_model  FOR gv_model MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_plant  TYPE mcode MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_year  TYPE t009b-bdatj OBLIGATORY.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ELSE.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.


AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR s_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name   = 'S_FILE'
      program_name = sy-cprog
    IMPORTING
      file_name    = s_file.


START-OF-SELECTION.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
*building the header table for excel download. 
    PERFORM build_headings.
*getting the saving location on local system.
    PERFORM get_save_location.
*save the file in local.
    PERFORM download.
  ELSEIF rb_up = 'X'.
*building the header table for excel download. 
    PERFORM build_headings.
*save the uploaded data.
    PERFORM upload_file.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  GET_SAVE_LOCATION
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_save_location.
  CONCATENATE 'Template_' sy-datum sy-uzeit INTO gv_filename.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = 'Select the location'
      default_extension = 'xls'
      default_file_name = gv_filename
    CHANGING
      filename          = gv_filename
      path              = gv_path
      fullpath          = gv_fullpath
      user_action       = gv_result.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  BUILD_HEADINGS
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_headings.
  gs_heading-heading = 'Plant'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  gs_heading-heading = 'Model name'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  DATA: lt_month_names LIKE TABLE OF t247.
  CALL FUNCTION 'MONTH_NAMES_GET'
    TABLES
      month_names = lt_month_names
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS      = 1.

  LOOP AT lt_month_names INTO DATA(ls_month_name).
    CONCATENATE ls_month_name-ltx '' P_year INTO DATA(lv_header).
    gs_heading-heading = lv_header.
    APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
    CLEAR gs_heading.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  DOWNLOAD
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download.
  LOOP AT p_model INTO DATA(s_model).
    gs_data-col1 = p_plant.
    gs_data-col2 = s_model-low.
    APPEND gs_data TO gt_data.
    CLEAR : gs_data.
  ENDLOOP.
  IF gv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename   = gv_fullpath
        filetype   = 'DAT'
      TABLES
        data_tab   = gt_data
        fieldnames = gt_heading
      EXCEPTIONS
        OTHERS     = 22.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      gv_template_downloaded = abap_true.

      CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>execute
        EXPORTING
          document = gv_fullpath
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS   = 10.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  UPLOAD_FILE
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM upload_file.

  CALL FUNCTION 'TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP'
    EXPORTING
      i_tab_raw_data       = it_raw
      i_filename           = s_file
    TABLES
      i_tab_converted_data = gt_data
    EXCEPTIONS
      conversion_failed    = 1
      OTHERS               = 2.

  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    LOOP AT gt_heading INTO DATA(lv_fieldname).
      CLEAR: lv_field,gs_fieldcat.
      lv_field = |COL{ sy-tabix }|.
      gs_fieldcat-fieldname = lv_field."lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-seltext_l = lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-col_pos = sy-tabix.
      gs_fieldcat-ctabname = 'gt_data'.
      gs_fieldcat-edit = 'X'.
      APPEND gs_fieldcat TO gt_fieldcat.
    ENDLOOP.

    gv_data = gt_data.
    DELETE gv_data  INDEX 1.
    gf_data = gv_data.


    LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
      READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
      index = 1.
      DO 12 TIMES.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
          gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
          gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
          gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
          gs_prod_plan-zmonth = index.
          gs_prod_plan-zyear = p_year.
          MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
        ENDIF.
        index = index + 1.
      ENDDO.
    ENDLOOP.

    CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
      EXPORTING
        i_callback_program       = sy-repid
        i_callback_pf_status_set = ' '
        i_callback_user_command  = 'SAVE'
        i_default                = 'X'
        i_save                   = 'S'
        it_fieldcat              = gt_fieldcat
      TABLES
        t_outtab                 = gv_data
      EXCEPTIONS
        program_error            = 1
        OTHERS                   = 2.


    MESSAGE 'File uploaded and data captured successfully.' TYPE 'S'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading file.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM save USING rcomm TYPE sy-ucomm
      sel TYPE slis_selfield.

  CASE sy-ucomm.
    WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'.
      LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
        READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
        READ TABLE gf_data INTO gd_data INDEX sy-tabix.
        IF <fs_input> NE gd_data.
          DO 12 TIMES.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_month> TO <fs_value_1>.
            DATA: lv_date_string TYPE string,
                  lv_month_num   TYPE char2,
                  lv_day         TYPE char2,
                  lv_month_name  TYPE string.

            lv_date_string = <fs_value_1>.

            SPLIT lv_date_string AT '/' INTO lv_month_num lv_day lv_year.

            IF sy-subrc = 0.
              CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
              gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
              gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
              gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
              gs_prod_plan-zmonth = lv_month_num.
              gs_prod_plan-zyear = lv_year.
              MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
            ENDIF.
          ENDDO.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
  ENDCASE.
ENDFORM.

Conclusion:

We have implemented a report that generates a dynamic Excel template and allows uploading of the same. The user provides a year as input, and we retrieve the corresponding month names using the function module MONTH_NAMES_GET. Based on this, we dynamically create an internal table with the required primary keys and month columns for that year. This internal table is then downloaded as an Excel file. For the upload functionality, the user fills in the Excel file and uploads it. We use field catalog and field symbols to process the uploaded data, and we have also added functionality to modify the data at runtime within the ALV grid display.

entry.title: CREATE AND ASSIGN AUTHORIZATION POLICIES IN IAS
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP Identity Authentication Services (IAS) provides secure access management for SAP cloud applications. One of the core features in IAS is Authorization Policies, which allow administrators to control access to applications and resources based on defined rules.

In this blog, we’ll go through the steps to create and assign authorization policies in IAS, ensuring only the right users have the right level of access.

Why Authorization Policies Matter

  • Control user access based on attributes like group, role, or user ID

  • Enforce compliance and security requirements

  • Provide flexibility for hybrid or multi-application scenarios

  • Simplify administration by centralizing access control in IAS

Please follow the step by step process to create authorization policies in IAS :

HOW THE IAS SUPER ADMIN CAN CREATE AND ASSIGN AUTHORIZATION POLICIES IN IAS

  1. CREATION OF AUTHORIZATION POLICIES

This document tells you how you can assign the authorization policies or give admin access to Granular level to HR managing their own HR Organization and division. This will help to give granular access to HR admin in IAS by creating the authorization policies in IAS so that they can see only the employees belonging to their organization unit and reset the password for them.

We are creating the custom Policies for customers as we have different divisions and organization, and we would like to give access to the HR managers to their respective divisions accordingly.

The screen shots below are for your reference from the test system, and you can use the same step for production as well.

Prerequisite: You have SUPER ADMIN access to IAS tenants in which you are going to create the authorization policy.

IAS Tenants:

For Test: https://XXXXXXX.accounts.ondemand.com/admin/

  1. Login to the test IAS System:

Give the URL https://XXXXXXX.accounts.ondemand.com/admin/ in the browser and the below   window will open.

  1. Give your Email or Username and password to login to IAS an ADMIN and click on continue.

  1. You will see the login screen of IAS as shown below:

 

  1. Not go to the “Application Resources” and click on the tenant settings :

Here , you can go the policy-based authorization and enabled the option in the right context window.

  1. Now go to the “Application Resources” section and click on the SuccessFactors application.  

  1. Click on the applications and it will show you the screen below.    
  2. Go the Administration console as shown below under the System Application. You can see below highlighted one:

 

  1. Now you can see to the right-side pane of the screen with Authorization policies.  Click on that and you will see the screen below.

  1. Click on the create button and give a name for which you want to create a new policy. It will ask for the Policy name and the Base Policies. We have given a name as IMAS_AUT_USER as an example to show and giving access to Read the users and update the users’ details in IAS (Identity Authentication services).

  1. Now click on the create button and it will take you to the screen below:

  1. Here click on the + sign and it will take you to the screen below where you can choose the user. Division and assign the division according to the employee export file. 

  1. Choose for both the restrictions + Sign and choose user. division for both the places because we would like to give admin access to HR to see and update only the users belonging to those division.

13. Now we need to find the value from the SF export file as attached here to see what the value is coming from the SuccessFactors for the organization/division and use the exact same field value here.

PFA.

 

  1. Check the column AS and field name custom06 value and use the same value in the above user.division field. In our case we have set up rules for AUT, so we need to filter column06 from the exported file from SF and search for AUT. We go custom06 value as AUT(AUT). This value needs to be updated in the user. Division value . ( Please note you need to fill this custom06 values from Successfactors to each user in IAS by using the source and target transformation) .

Source transformation code :

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:successfactors:2.0:User']['customFields'][?(@.customFieldName == 'custom06')]['value']",

                "targetPath": "$.custom06",

                "optional": true

            }

Target transformation code :

{

                "sourcePath": "$.custom06",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['division']"

            }

  1. The same value we need to update in the user. Division field as shown below.
  2. At the end you can add the below authorization as well USE schemas.READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS click on ADD USE and select from the dropdown the authorization as USE schemas.READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS. This is also required READ_SCIM_SCHEMAS authorization policies. Otherwise, you won't be able to see and access the Export Users’ title.

  1. Click on confirmation and it will be added.

  1. First click on SAVE and then click on the Assignments tab and add the user you would like to give this   authorization.

  1. Assign/click on ADD to add the users whom you want to give granular authorization. Please note that the user should exist in the IAS User directory. Now I am giving access to one user for example Mohana@gmail.com

 I can click on add and search the user using the email address and add the user. After that the user is assigned to the new authorization policy and the user can access the employees belongs to AUT organization.

 

  1. Search for the user whom you want to give access to.

  1. Click on the ADD.  The user is added successfully.

The above steps complete the creation of the new Authorization policies and assignment of users.

HOW TO ASSING AUTHORIZATION TO HR ADMIN/ ANY USERS USING THE EXISTING AUTHORIZATION POLICIES  

  1. Follow the steps from 1 to 7 and complete the steps as mentioned above. ( The above example shows the process , now you want to assign other users in the same authorization policies)
  2. Now you are in the authorization policies tab, and you need to click on the filter to easily access the custom packages created and choose the one required for you to be updated. Please note that IMSA_AUT_USER is the test Authorization policy. I have created many authorizations policy for each division, that is why you can see many customer packages but here I am assigning the user to only IMSA_AUT_USER authorization policy.

  1. Click on the filter and choose customer packages.

  1. Click ok to see all the customer packages filtered and you can choose the one required for you. I am choosing the IMSA_AUT_USER and would like to assign one existing user.

  1. Now open the customer authorization policies named IMSA_AUT_USER. You can choose the package as per your requirements. I would like to give access to the below user for the authorization policies IMSA_AUT_USER.

  1. You must click on the IMSA_AUT_USER authorization policy as shown in the above step. It will show you the screen below. Go to the assignments tab and assign/add the above user.

Click on the ADD and search for the user with username as BHR.

Now the user has assigned the authorization policies created by you. You can reset the password for this user in IAS and try to login and you will see that this user will be able to see only a few users who are belonging to the division AUT(AUT). 

Please note : You must remove the user from Administrator group if it is assigned as an administrator otherwise the Administrator group in IAS under user & Authorizations->administrator will give more permissions to the administrator.
